caption: Figure 1: On UCI data with n, m = 28, 29
description: This figure shows the correlation between Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis (SCCA) and CCA for various sparsity levels (s1, s2) on a real UCI dataset (n=28, m=29). The heatmap visualizes the ratio of correlations between SCCA and CCA for different combinations of s1 and s2. It provides insights into the maximum sparsity that SCCA can achieve while maintaining a high correlation with the full data.
section: 5.2 Illustration of the impact sparsity levels on SCCA
